work.title: Comic Relief — Comic Adventure
text: I worked with Goodboy Digital to create this interactive animated comicbook with minigames, interactions and a dynamic user-voted ending. It was built to work across mobile and desktop devices using PixiJS, Pixi Animate and sono.

work.title: Kinder — Kindernauts
text: I was responsible for coding the playful interactive map which forms centrepiece of the Kindernauts website. Made using PixiJS, it involved lots of programmatic motion along with zoom and pan controls. I designed it as an isolated app to trivialise integration into the main site.

work.title: W+K London — wklondon.com
text: On this project I worked directly with the team at W+K London to build this brand new website, running on Wordpress with a modern responsive front-end built on SUIT CSS and ES6 JS.

work.title: Primo Toys — primotoys.com
text: After the conclusion of a very successful Kickstarter, Primo Toys needed a new website and ecommerce store to enable them to sell their product directly. I built this responsive site and store and additionally created a small node.js app to help manage orders.

work.title: Manchester City — mancity.com
text: Working with the talented team at Code and Theory, I helped create this innovative new site with 2 other devs over a period of 8 months. Among other duties, I was tasked with coding powerful [video features](https://www.mancity.com/citytv/).

work.title: Google — Inside Abbey Road
text: I enjoyed pushing the Web Audio API to its limits on this virtual tour of Abbey Road studios which also entailed lots of WebGL and intricate UI work. I led the development over its year-long gestation. It was well received and won the [FWA Site of the Month.](https://thefwa.com/cases/inside-abbey-road) and the Webby Award in the music category.

work.title: Sky — Fluid Viewing
text: The goal of this campaign site was to announce Sky’s new ‘fluid viewing’ product. I led the development team, building a dynamic video experience complemented with interactive audio effects using my audio library sono.

work.title: Ray-Ban — Made
text: Made is a quirky platform runner game for both mobile and desktop. I led the development, using PixiJS, Phaser and Tiled Map Editor. The game features 4 distinct levels and boss battles, as well as power-ups based on Ray-Ban sunglasses and various cutscenes. It was a lot of fun to make and won an [FWA SOTD and MOTD](https://thefwa.com/cases/made).

work.title: John Lewis — Monty's Christmas
text: I worked on this interactive 3d storybook designed for Google Cardboard. I was technical lead on the project, building the initial prototype and supporting the team as they expanded it out into the final product. The tech used included THREE.js, the Web Audio API and Cordova.

work.title: Chanel — Chance Chanel
text: I was responsible for leading the development of this responsive interactive film experience for Chanel that was progressively enhanced to work across the limitations of many different platforms. It was built using HTML5 video, PixiJS and Sass.

work.title: Red Bull — Revolutions in Sound
text: The idea behind this project was to tell the story of UK club culture by connecting large datasets of content from various sources. I led development, using Angular and Google services with content drawn from users, as well as Firebase, SoundCloud and YouTube. Close attention to detail was required in designing the UX and app structure to handle the web of interlinked content.

work.title: Open Source — Imagepack
text: Imagepack is a node.js utility that packs images into a binary file, reducing load times for large image sequences. It has since been used on multiple projects.

work.title: Open Source — sono
text: I created and continue to maintain this open source library for creative audio using the Web Audio API with a fallback to HTML5 audio for older browsers. It facilitates all aspects of audio management and makes it easy to add effects such as echo or distortion.

work.title: Ludum Dare — Deep Sea Freediver
text: I made this mobile mini-game creating the art, code and music in 48 hours for the Ludum Dare game jam using PixiJS and the Phaser game engine. On mobile the player can tilt their device to guide the diver past various obstacles.

work.title: Experiment — Gif Inbox
text: Experimenting with Python and Google AppEngine, I made this app that extracted and collated the many weird gifs arriving in my email inbox.

work.title: Open Source — Boid
text: This is a JavaScript library that produces natural looking movement, based on the famous [Boids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boids) flocking behaviours. I have used it in various projects.

work.title: Nike — My Time Is Now
text: Working closely with W+K London, I led development on this interactive film project for Nike filled with rabbit holes that take you into mini-games. It won several awards at Cannes as well as an FWA SOTD.

work.title: Stella Artois — Christmas Carole
text: I was the lead developer on this fun project where we achieved convincing real time compositing of Google Streetview images into green screen film footage to produce a video showing the band driving to your house to play you a song. It won an FWA SOTD.

work.title: Vigorsol — Captain Ice
text: Captain Ice is a mini-game created using an interesting blend of video footage and pixel art. The player has to hit the correct key combo within a tight time limit to score a hit.

work.title: Adidas — Unite All Originals
text: This project makes use of the Web Speech API to create an interactive music video, featuring Hip-Hop legends Run DMC, with hidden animations that can be triggered by saying the right keyword. The Adidas products featured in the video can be viewed contextually at any time, pausing the video.

work.title: Menicon — Miru
text: This project comprises a sublime 360 film shot using a custom-made octocopter camera rig. I was responsible for building a custom 3d skybox video player to render the film in browser.

work.title: Asos — Urban Tour
text: The idea behind this project was to create an interactive fashion catalogue slash music video. The user can 'freeze' the scene, see a 360 view of the clothes and access details and ecommerce links. I led the development team and the project went on to win 3 Cannes Lions, a Webby and FWA SOTD.

work.title: Hugo Boss — Kino
text: In this project we used the Camera API to allow the user to 'See things differently' by tilting their head, thus toggling different layers of surreal film content. It won the FWA SOTD award.

work.title: IKEA — Happy Inside
text: This website for IKEA is a competition where users can win a product by guessing which of the cats roaming the store would be attracted to it. It involved Facebook integration and a game mechanic stitching videos together to reveal the outcome. It was a big viral hit to the point where it was temporarily blocked from Facebook for generating too many posts!

work.title: BBC — One Life
text: The idea behind this project was to create an interactive film trailer for a BBC nature film. Users can drag up at any time during the trailer to get additional content related to the shot currently on screen. Dragging down accesses global content such as audience reactions and interviews. The background changes based on the average color of the current frame. It won an FWA SOTD.

work.title: Diesel — Diesel Island
text: This project realised an island community populated by Facebook users and filled with stupid fun features including a pirate radio station and 3d 'Islandview' fashion catalogue that users can navigate like Streetview. It won an FWA SOTD and Cannes Cyber Lion.

work.title: Lexus — Dark Ride
text: I led development of this groundbreaking interactive short film with a branching narrative. It incorporates dialogue recorded by the user and several decision points which change the film along with pannable scenes and immersive sound design. It won the [FWA People's Choice Site of the Year](https://thefwa.com/cases/lexus-dark-ride?c=SOTYPCA)

work.title: Diesel — A Hundred Lovers
text: A Hundred Lovers is an interactive music video slash fashion catalogue featuring very cool 'match-cut' film editing. All the clothes and participants were tagged and their details revealed by hovering over them. As well as code the site, I made an app to tag the hotspots in the film. The project won an FWA SOTD.

work.title: Philips — Carousel
text: I was responsible for leading the development of this innovative interactive film project. It features a dynamic recreation of the ambilight effect and allows users to segue seamlessly into behind the scenes footage. It won my first FWA SOTD and ultimately the Cannes Grand Prix. Its impact was such that it even has a [Wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carousel_%28advertisement%29)!
